definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
Peranakan Chinese (Baba-Nyonya), an ethnic group of Chinese residing in the Malay peninsula (also known as Straits Chinese)
Peranakan Chinese (Baba-Nyonya), an ethnic group of Chinese residing in the Malay peninsula (also known as Straits Chinese)

sentences.english: Winners of the Talent Maths Competition in Batam, Indonesia year 2008.
sentences.chinese: 2008年峇淡岛才能数学比赛之得奖者。

sentences.english: A baba is a Peranakan man.
A baba is a Peranakan man.
In the Permatang Pauh by-election, 70% of the voters were Malays .
sentences.chinese: 然而在峇东埔补选中，70%的选民是马来人。

sentences.english: Many of Malay dishes are added Belacan to increase tastes.
sentences.chinese: 许多马来佳肴都会加入峇拉煎来提味。

sentences.english: Roundtrip Economy class air ticket for Hong Kong and Bali on HX.
sentences.chinese: 香港航空公司来回香港至峇里机票。

sentences.english: Moved to a bungalow at Balmoral Road.
sentences.chinese: 培群迁至峇摩劳路一洋房上课。

sentences.english: The most exotic place I have ever visited was Bali.
sentences.chinese: 峇里岛是我去过最充满异国情调的地方。

sentences.english: After hearing of the bombings in Bali, would you still want to go there?
sentences.chinese: 听到峇里岛发生爆炸案，你还想去那里吗？

definition: Johor (state of Malaysia at south of Malayan peninsula)
old name for the town of Kampot in Cambodia, now written 貢布|贡布[Gong4 bu4]
see 槤枷|梿枷[lian2 jia1], flail/to thresh (using a flail)
Professor Ibrahim Gambari (1944-), Nigerian scholar and diplomat, ambassador to UN 1990-1999, UN envoy to Burma from 2007
Yogyakarta, city of Java, Indonesia, and capital of the Special Region of Yogyakarta 日惹特區|日惹特区[Ri4 ye3 Te4 qu1]
Perlis, state of Malaysia adjacent to Thailand, capital Kangar 加央[Jia1 yang1]
